content.description:
<math alttext="2 K, solid, plus 2 H 2 O, liquid, reacts to produce 2 K O H, aqueous, plus H 2, gas; delta H naught equals negative 393 kilojoules per mole of reaction." display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>KOH</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>393</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>
When <math alttext="3.9 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>3.9</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is added to <math alttext="200, decimal point, milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>200</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of water at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> in a calorimeter, all the <math alttext="K, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> reacts with the water as represented by the equation above.
content.question: Which of the following is true about the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> of the water after the reaction is complete?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi><mo><</mo><mn>7</mn></math>
<math alttext="p H is greater than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi><mo>></mo><mn>7</mn></math>
The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> of the water cannot be determined without additional information.

content.answer: <math alttext="p H is greater than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi><mo>></mo><mn>7</mn></math>

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
